feed.subtitle: SAP HANA Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Use Hana Graph Engine with Springboot
entry.content:
I'm building a Spring Boot application and considering using the SAP HANA Graph engine as graph database. I'm wondering if there‚Äôs an ORM framework, like Spring Data Neo4j, that supports direct interaction with HANA Graph.

It appears that we can model vertex and edge tables using Spring JPA, but when it comes to GraphScript, we are limited to using stored procedures. That means I have to create the procedure on the HANA instance first and then call it from the service instead of using a native query with Spring JPA for DB interaction.

Is there a more direct way to use GraphScript within SpringBoot without predefining stored procedures in HANA?

entry.title: Insert / Update / Delete data from Hana Cloud to Hana S/4 Rise
entry.content:
I have a Hana Database cloud on BTP and insert data on tables TMF* This data i want insert ou sincronize directily on S/4Hana RISE 2020.

The SOAP or REST processes are only available in S/4 2021, and we don't have time to upgrade.
Is there a native integrator that synchronizes or inserts/updates/deletes data from Hana Cloud to Hana on S4?

entry.title: SAP S/4 Hana : Multiple API Call In One Transaction
entry.content:
Hi,

I‚Äôm developing a CAP application using Node.js. I‚Äôm consuming remote APIs from SAP S/4HANA Cloud (public edition)‚Äîfor example, reading Business Partners and creating Sales Orders. At one point, I need to call multiple APIs to perform updates and deletions in sequence. What happens if one of these calls fails midway? How can I roll back everything I‚Äôve done? Is there a good way to handle this?

Thanks.

entry.title: How to access the SAP HANA Cloud database behind a BTP ABAP Environment instance?
entry.content:
Hi Community,

we are currently working with the SAP BTP ABAP Environment and would like to better understand the technical access to the SAP HANA Cloud instance that runs behind it. We are aware that the underlying SAP HANA Cloud instance is managed by the SAP ABAP Environment, but we are unsure about the supported ways to access it or extend it with custom database artifacts.

We have two related questions:

1. Direct access to the database
Is it possible to connect directly to the SAP HANA Cloud instance behind the BTP ABAP Environment ‚Äî for example via Database Explorer or any external SQL tool ‚Äî in order to create or inspect custom SQL views or procedures?
We already tried to create a SAP HANA Cloud project in SAP Business Application Studio, but the setup failed with the message that no database instance is available, even though we know the ABAP Environment uses a managed HANA Cloud instance in the background.
If such access is possible, where can we find or retrieve the database credentials / connection details?

2. Access pattern for SaaS scenarios
We are planning to build SaaS solutions on top of the BTP ABAP Environment.
In our CAP-based SaaS applications, we can retrieve tenant-specific database (hdi container) credentials via the Service Manager.
Is there a similar mechanism available in the BTP ABAP Environment to programmatically access or manage database connections (hdi containers) for different tenants?

If direct access is currently not possible, is it planned or on the SAP roadmap to allow connecting to the managed HANA Cloud instance in the future?

Any guidance, documentation, or personal experience around this would be very much appreciated!

Maybe @FrankJentsch can also share some insights here, since you have been very active around BTP ABAP Environment topics in the past.

Thanks & kind regards
Johannes

entry.title: Replicate data from SAP BW into SAP HANA Cloud
entry.content:

Now - we did create a BW Query. However, when I try to replciate the query, I get a error. The error happens when I try to start the replication. 

Appreciate your inputs on the following: 

1. Best way to get data from BW into HANA Cloud View

2. Is it feasible to use BW Query for this purpose

3. If BW data is stored in InfoObjects/DSO/Info Provider etc. - Is it feasible to replicate them directly into HANA. 

Regards,

Sharath

entry.title: How to get import error logs in HANA Cloud?
entry.content:
I'm importing some datasets to SAP HANA Cloud, using IMPORT FROM.

Here's the maneuver:

CREATE TABLE "FOO"."BAR" (
  id   VARCHAR(256) PRIMARY KEY
  name NVARCHAR(5000) NOT NULL
  ts TIMESTAMP NOT NULL
);

IMPORT FROM PARQUET FILE
'gs://foo/bar/000000000000.parquet'
INTO "FOO"."BAR"
WITH
FAIL ON INVALID DATA
CREDENTIAL 'GCS'
COLUMN LIST (id, name, ts)
FILE COLUMN LIST (1,2,3);

If there's an issue with the file, like a NULL, the import fails with a generic  some of rows have failed to be imported error.

For on prem, I can use the ERROR LOG option to get a error log. But in Hana Cloud, this options makes the import fail immediately. It makes sense; I don't think there's a filesystem I would even be able access even if the ERROR LOG file option did work, right?

So, how can I get file import error details, when importing into a HANA Cloud instance?

entry.title: AWS Route 53 setup for multiple Hana Cloud instances with Private Link
entry.content:
So, I'm planning  on spinning up multiple hana cloud instances, and I want to use AWS private link.

Getting one instance in AWS us-east to work was easy; just configure Route 53 to point

*.hana.prod-us10.hanacloud.ondemand.com -> the vpc endpoint

But let's say I've got another instance I want to connect to, within the same VPC.... should be easy? Just reconfigure Route 53 to do:
<uuid>.hana.prod-us10.hanacloud.ondemand.com -> the vpc endpoint

Well, that does not work!

I discovered that hana cloud actually "redirects" to an internal hostname, upon connection. The hostname is in a form that's basically impossible to define in route53 as it requires a 5-digit unknown suffix (and route53 can't do wildcards in a partial subdomain). Here's the spec: https://me.sap.com/notes/3325646

The note does mention an unsupported option that would prevent the redirect, which would then make it easy to map things in route 53. But, it advises against doing that...

Seems to me like unless the service endpoint id is the same for every hana instance in us-east-1,  I don't see how it's possible to use private link when having multiple instances.

I did try setting up a custom domain, but getting TLS errors when connecting using that. This could work, I just don't know how to set that up correctly.

I know there must be a way, so am wondering, has anybody figured this out?

entry.title: SAP HANA DB replication task, projection mapping
entry.content:
Hi All, 

I have a rather simple Replication task using SDI to retrieve data from ERP Backend as a Virtual table and want to map this to a column table on Hana Cloud. This is working ok.

I'm using the Hana Native artifact  *.hdbreptask GUID to achieve the above and more specific the projection here to do the needed mapping of fields. 

And here is my simple requirement/question.

How to map

  • from a source_date NVARCHAR(8) date - example '19991231' 
  • to  target_date of Date type - example  '1999-12-31'. 

This should be very simple, but I cannot figure out the syntax üòû

What did I try until now.

I tried to use TO_DATE function for this ( example TO_DATA("source_date", 'YYYYMMDD¬¥)), but I cannot get a valid syntax to achieve this..

entry.title: Is it possible to preview and print PDF form template of s4hana cloud's In-App CBO using BTP service
entry.content:

I would like to get the preview and print function of PDF form template for Custom Business Object (that is created in s4hana cloud using In-App/Key User Extensibility).

If yes, could you please guide me how to do it?

 

2. If In-App/Key User Extensibility is not possible, is it possible with BTP service?

I would like to create Custom Business Object by In-App/Key User Extensibility.

And for preview and print functions, I will use BTP service.

That kind of development, which BTP service should I use and how to develop it?

 

3. If both methods that are mentioned above cannot be worked, could you please guide me how can I develop that kind of requirement?

 

Thank You.

Best Regards,

Aye Chan

entry.title: Unable to Modify Backup Storage & Network Data Transfer Parameters During HANA DB Instance Creation
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

While creating a HANA DB instance in our SAP environment, we noticed that the backup storage and network data transfer parameters are being populated automatically. There doesn‚Äôt seem to be any option to modify or deselect these during instance creation.

However, in the SAP Discovery Center Estimator, these parameters can be adjusted, and the cost per capacity unit can vary accordingly.

Could someone please clarify:

  • Why are these parameters fixed during the actual HANA instance creation even though they are configurable in the estimator?
  • Is there any way (or specific service plan/region restriction) that allows modification of these parameters before provisioning?

Would like to validate if this behavior is by design or if there are configuration options we might be missing.

Thanks in advance for your insights.

entry.title: Integration of SAP CPI and SAP DataSphere using JDBC
entry.content:
Integration Between SAP CPI and SAP DataSphere (JDBC Connection)  
 
JDBC ‚Äì JAVA DATABASE CONNECTIVITY 
 
Why Recommendation for JDBC Over OData API : 
JDBC is recommended over OData when consuming large-scale records (e.g., 100,000+) because JDBC streams data directly from the database with better performance and less overhead, while OData is optimized for lightweight, paginated, service-based access. 
 
Problem statement: 3337495 - OData API returns less records than expected due paging 
Pagination limits in OData and Ariba APIs can be handled in SAP CPI using a looping process call. 
 
Goal: Connect CPI to a database used by DataSphere (JDBC) and run a simple read data from the (Analytical Model / Table /View).  
 
For the Write / Delete / Update method, the attached SAP Help Portal Link has syntax in the reference section. 
 
Prerequisites: 

  1. SAP DataSphere ‚Äì Subscribed account (‚ö† Trial has limited features, JDBC not supported) 
  1. SAP Integration Suite ‚Äì Subscribed or Trial (JDBC actions supported) 

 

SAP DataSphere Step by Step Guide : 
 

Step 

Action / Notes 

1. Create a Space 

DataSphere ‚Üí Space Management ‚Üí New Space ‚Üí Name it ‚Üí Create. 

2. Create Table / Analytical Model 

Data Builder ‚Üí In your Space ‚Üí New ‚Üí Table or Analytical Model ‚Üí define fields & data types ‚Üí Save & Publish. 
*Verify Table/Model Deployed Successfully. * 

3. Prepare / Load Data 

Load data manually for testing cases. Otherwise load CSV/import to table via Data Builder/Data Integration. 

4. Note Schema & Object Names 

Record schema name, table name, and view names for JDBC SQL use. 
* Created space name is the SCHEMA name and Collect Table / Model name * 

5. Decide Where to Create DB User 

If HANA Cloud ‚Üí use HANA Cockpit/DB Explorer. If on-prem DB ‚Üí use DB admin tools or contact DB Admin. 
* We are using the HANA cloud system for practical session* 

6. Create JDBC DB User 

DB admin tool ‚Üí Security/Users ‚Üí New User ‚Üí set username & strong password ‚Üí Save. 
*Check Active status of User* 

7. Grant Privileges for the DB user 

Assign only required privileges (e.g., SELECT for read; add INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE for CRUD). Best practice: create role JDBC_ROLE and assign. 

8. Prepare JDBC Connection Details 

Gather JDBC URL (e.g.  sample URL from datasphere: z*********-abc.hana.prod-eu10.hanacloud.ondemand.com 
Format for CPI JDBC Material: 
jdbc:sap://<host>:<port>/?encrypt=true&validateCertificate=true 

 
SAP Integration Suite Step by Step Guide : 
 
Create a Package & Artifact 

  • In CPI ‚Üí Design ‚Üí Create a new package ‚Üí Add an integration flow artifact. 
  • ‚úÖ Make sure your CPI user has the required roles to create and access design-time artifacts. 
     

Go to Monitoring ‚Üí JDBC Material 

  • In CPI ‚Üí Monitor ‚Üí Integrations and APIs ‚Üí Manage Security ‚Üí JDBC Material

     

     
  • ‚Üí Add JDBC Data Source. ‚Üí Select HANA cloud  

     

     
     
  • Provide JDBC URL in the correct format (e.g., jdbc:sap://<hana-host>:443/?encrypt=true&validateCertificate=true). 

     

     
  • Enter DB username and password (use the dedicated JDBC user created earlier in DataSphere). 

     

     
  • Save and deploy the JDBC material. 
    •  

    Apply JDBC Material in iFlow

    • In your integration flow, configure the JDBC receiver adapter ‚Üí select the JDBC data source created.
    • Use SQL queries (SELECT) in the Processing tab or provide XML query body. Here, I‚Äôm using SQL SELECT * to fetch all records from the table.

     


    Step 1: Timer Start
     In this iFlow, the Start Timer is configured with a Simple Schedule ‚Üí None ‚Üí On Deployment, which means the integration flow automatically triggers immediately after deployment.

     


    Step 2: Content Modifier
    Use this SQL query to fetch all records with the body operation.
     SELECT * FROM "<Schema>"."<Model/TableName>"

     



    Step 3: Request Reply & JDBC Receiver Adapter
         ‚Üí Use the deployed JDBC Data Source alias in the JDBC Material in the previous step and set Max records count based on your requirement.
    ‚Üí JDBC Maximum Records per call:  2,147,483,647

     


    Sample data Response from JDBC Connection:

     



    References :

    CPI JDBC ‚Äì XML Query in Body for CRUD Operations (Syntax Guide)
     link:
    https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-integration/sap-cloud-integration/payload-and-operation

entry.title: What are the ‚Äústandard checks‚Äù executed by the Manage Remediation Processes ‚Äì Products app
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I have a question about the Manage Remediation Processes ‚Äì Products app, which was newly introduced in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release.

According to the documentation (see screenshot below), when starting the validation process, the system will ‚Äúcarry out the standard checks.‚Äù

 

However, it‚Äôs not clearly documented what these standard checks actually include ‚Äî for example:

Are these the same validation rules as used in Master Data Governance (MDG). Is there a list or documentation from SAP describing all the standard checks performed by this app?

Should the ‚ÄúManage Remediation Processes ‚Äì Products‚Äù app be used during the Hypercare phase? 

I would really appreciate if anyone could share details, or a reference link / note from SAP explaining what these standard checks are.

Thank you in advance for your help!

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
App: Manage Remediation Processes ‚Äì Products
Feature area: Master Data Remediation / Product Master

entry.title: Seeking Guidance on Configuring Access for Vendor Transactions in S4HANA Public Cloud System
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We have four users with specific roles and restrictions:

User A:
- Can post entries for a specific vendor.
- Needs access to all postings and reports related to that vendor.

User B:
- No access to any data related to the vendor managed by User A.

User C:
- Can make payments for all vendors except the one managed by User A.
- Vendor managed by User A should not be visible in any payment applications.

User üòß
- Can make payments only for the vendor managed by User A.

Applications in use include:
- Maintain Business Partner
- Create Supplier Invoice Advance
- Manage Supplier Line Item
- Display Supplier Balance
- Manage Automatic Payment
- Display Journal Entries (with respect to vendor)
- Supplier Down Payment
- Post Outgoing Payment

Could you please suggest ways to configure these settings and meet the requirements?
